page.title: 15SOCIAL AMENITIES
page.content: Many of the social functions held in Merton tend to centre around the Village Hall.Built in the early 1970's on the site of the Recreation Ground it is managed by a Hall Committee and a Management Body of Trustees.Changing Rooms for the local Football Team are attached to it.The Hall has never really become a focal point of village life but it belongs to the whole village where such events as the Fete can be held,the celebration of important events can be organised and it is also a safe place for the children to play.The Playground that adjoins it contains swings and slides. The Hall was extended in 1984 and it provides a meeting place for bingo, church and mothers and toddlers groups. It is hired for jumble sales,coffee mornings and dances.Allotments nearby provide additional garden space.
